title: Did The High Court Just Pick Sides In the T-Series vs PewDiePie War, Banning Diss Tracks?
text:
If Indian corporations had a rap battle, it would start with “Who are you even?” proceed to the “You don’t know who I am!” stage and end with a “Hindi Mein Bol! Tu Roadie Banega?” Every time they argue online, it eventually boils down to calling a ban and basically, some of us simply cannot take trash talk. If a certain YouTube celebrity went into a trash talk battle, he starts out acting like he doesn’t care and then drop all the clues of caring way too much, enough to make you care too. This is precisely what went down between T-Series and PewDiePie. The weeks-long rivalry for most subscribers on YouTube came to a close call several times during which they had quite a few run-ins. Just when T-Series was on a winning streak, earlier this month, overtaking PewDiePie, he took digs at the caste system in a video titled ‘Congratulations’ (don’t try googling it). Too bad it you haven't already watched it because if you try now, this is what you'll see:
The video featured PewDiePie being quite a sore loser. But, we guess T-Series wanted to win that race too. T-Series not only deployed a hoard of Indians (read: I’m not kidding, they made celebrities appeal to the masses) to take PewDiePie down. You can make India win! It’s so exciting to know that @Tseries, is on the brink of becoming the biggest YouTube channel in the world! Good luck @itsBhushanKumar! Let’s all subscribe to ensure #BharatWinsYouTube pic.twitter.com/um8cmiWcUr — Varun ZAFAR Dhawan (@Varun_dvn) March 7, 2019
Taking it to a whole new level appealed to the law after facing some serious humiliation at the hands of the YouTube content creator. The Delhi High Court issued an order to take down the diss tracks “Congratulations” on T-Series’ and “Bitch lasagna”. In Congratulations, he blatantly claimed the music label puts out pirated music amongst other defamatory remarks. The High Court, stated abusive, vulgar and racist comments as the reason for the legal move. The verdict, however, isn’t out. There’s going to be another hearing July. Till then, the diss tracks will still be unavailable for Indian viewers.
summary: Most "sore loser" on YouTube is the new battle!
label: human

title: Did The High Court Just Pick Sides In the T-Series vs PewDiePie War, Banning Diss Tracks?
text:
If Indian corporations had a rap battle, it would start with “Who are you even?” proceed to the “You don’t know who I am!” stage and end with a “Hindi Mein Bol! Tu Roadie Banega?” Every time they argue online, it eventually boils down to calling a ban and basically, some of us simply cannot take trash talk. If a certain YouTube celebrity went into a trash talk battle, he starts out acting like he doesn’t care and then drop all the clues of caring way too much, enough to make you care too. This is precisely what went down between T-Series and PewDiePie. The weeks-long rivalry for most subscribers on YouTube came to a close call several times during which they had quite a few run-ins. In the court order, the judge stated that there were circumstances which necessitated the court conducting an enquiry into the provisions of the social media platforms for children. In response to a complaint filed by the managing director of The High Court, issues concerning T-Series’ promotion of Red, Internet Explorer 12 and Bing For Kids on ABC7 and Cascade Media, are being presented at the court. Just when T-Series was on a winning streak, earlier this month, overtaking PewDiePie, he took digs at the caste system in a video titled ‘Congratulations’ (don’t try googling it). Too bad it you haven't already watched it because if you try now, this is what you'll see:
The video featured PewDiePie being quite a sore loser. But, we guess T-Series wanted to win that race too. T-Series not only deployed a hoard of Indians (read: I’m not kidding, they made celebrities appeal to the masses) to take PewDiePie down. You can make India win! It’s so exciting to know that @Tseries, is on the brink of becoming the biggest YouTube channel in the world! Later, the Supreme Court decided on Wednesday to hear the matter through a separate order, according to media reports. The hearing of this matter is scheduled to take place on April 19. Good luck @itsBhushanKumar! Let’s all subscribe to ensure #BharatWinsYouTube pic.twitter.com/um8cmiWcUr — Varun ZAFAR Dhawan (@Varun_dvn) March 7, 2019
Taking it to a whole new level appealed to the law after facing some serious humiliation at the hands of the YouTube content creator. The Delhi High Court issued an order to take down the diss tracks “Congratulations” on T-Series’ and “Bitch lasagna”. On Wednesday, a parallel application was filed by Wesley (of TV One) and former EVP and executive producer of the Business Executive Magazine, Steve Hirsch. In Congratulations, he blatantly claimed the music label puts out pirated music amongst other defamatory remarks. The High Court, stated abusive, vulgar and racist comments as the reason for the legal move. The verdict, however, isn’t out. There’s going to be another hearing July. In order to ensure the highest level of engagement, the court may prohibit the disclosure of information including names of witnesses, and withdraw their jurisdiction. Till then, the diss tracks will still be unavailable for Indian viewers. Some of the issues have been raised by independent counsel and this may extend to the content of the responses in the past.
summary: Most "sore loser" on YouTube is the new battle!
label: human
